intro: Caruncularia serrulata, commonly known as the serrated caruncle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Caruncularia serrulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
